ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Speaking skills, a lot more vocabulary, and I am able to read text that are much more complex

I was auditing this class but this class really helped me build my reading knowledge of German. The reading exercises that we did in class were very helpful. I also appreciated that we went over grammar exercises in class.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: While the lessons in grammar were very helpful, I would have appreciated more structured work on vocabulary. Also, while I enjoyed the reading comprehension essays in the textbook, work on something longer e.g. a short book might have been a good way to develop skills. The email exchange was a bit disorganized though this was no one's fault, I wonder if there might be a better way to practice communication skills.

I strongly dislike the online learning platform but understand its merits from the professor's perspective. I liked the format of coursework every day of the week. I feel like it is a solid way to improve steadily.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 5 days a week is always painful, but the workload isn't too intense. Lots of little things to keep up with (project components, email exchange, etc.), and it's easy to fall behind, but there are also lots of opportunities to improve your grade throughout the semester. My writing improved most of all (two short essays, an email exchange, and a final project with written components). Would highly recommend Marion Gehlker as an instructor -- she's responsive, provides clear feedback, and is always immensely kind and understanding.
Yes,you learn a lot of different aspects about the german culture

I would recommend this course to a graduate student who needed to learn to read, speak, and write German. At my level of engagement, it was mostly helpful for developing my oral and reading skills but that was because I didn't participate in some of the writing components.
